text.p: These are the leading stories in the Turkish press on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Party leaders and president agree on making it easier to lift MPs' parliamentary immunity after two goverment deputies involved in security scandal.
- Islamist Prime Minister Necmettin Erbakan says Turkey and eight other Moslem states may develop a joint project to produce five million cars annually.
- President Suleyman Demirel says he will intervene if a security scandal casting light on ties between the state, police and organised crime is covered up.
- Head of military anti-guerrilla unit denies the state formed criminal gangs.
- Thousands of workers in protest meeting in western province of Izmit ask for democracy.
- Then prime minister Tansu Ciller hid a 1995 Stanford University report revealing the disadvantages of signing a customs union accord with European Union.
- Kurdistan Workers Party rebel leader Abdullah Ocalan warns of escalation of conflict if his calls for peace are not heeded.
- Iranian President Akbar Hashemi Rafsanjani leaves Turkey after four-day visit.
